event.title: was established as a slaving centre sometime before 1877

data.event: Located on the western shore of Lake Nyasa, it was established as a slaving centre sometime before 1877.
Some time before 1877 Karonga existed as the stronghold of Mlozi, a famous Arab slaver.

event.title: 1883 a British trading post, which formed

data.event: In 1883 a British trading post, which formed the basis of the modern town, was opened there.
British explorer Sir Harry Johnston bought the post in 1895 and ended the slave trade on Lake Nyasa's western shore.

event.title: bears a strong Swahili-Arab influence today

data.event: According to Lonely Planet, the town "still bears a strong Swahili-Arab influence today."

Professor Friedemann Schrenk of the Goethe University in Frankfurt told Reuters News that two students working on the excavation site in September, 2009 had discovered prehistoric tools and a tooth of a hominid.

event.title: lived between 100 million and 140 million years ago

data.event: The site also contains some of the earliest dinosaurs which lived between 100 million and 140 million years ago and early hominids believed to have lived between a million and 6 million years ago.
